name: places/ChIJ611nL5ZZwokRmDMRZBTNuro
formattedAddress: 123 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 123 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011-7801, USA

originalText.text: Our daughter stayed here this summer while working at a college internship in NYC. It’s an excellent choice for a short term rental, especially in her situation when you’re starting mid-month as they only charge you for the days you stay (rather than the whole month). The location can’t be beat and having full meals included (whether you take advantage of them or not), especially when you may work remotely a day or two, was a great benefit. It’s a safe, clean, and easy living option for a single with its own bathroom and we highly recommend it. Only negative is that you essentially can’t have anyone up to your room (they must stay in the lobby), but that’s similar to the NYU dorms restrictions (although even more strict).

originalText.text: It is the worth hotel I have ever seen with no service at night the heater is not working and the front desk says he can't do anything and the front desk is so rude

text.text: It is the worth hotel I have ever seen with no service at night the heater is not working and the front desk says he can't do anything and the front desk is so rude

originalText.text:
Worst residence ever. Room is super hot or super cold, you have to even pay for the air conditioner, meal sucks, no kitchen and any cooking is prohibited in the room, desk is rude and slow, and male can only get 2~3 floor choices. Too many restrictions and fire drilling frequently, I didn't even know I was in private school dorm or residence in NYC.
Took almost 2~3 months to get a room deposit refund. Not replying email very often, working super slow. I do not recommend if you don't like to feel like a prisoner in a cell.
한귝뷴둘 요기 줠대 가쥐마쎄여. 일춰뤼 종나 느리고 주방업꼬 취식또안대고 2천달러 썡으로 냘리꼬 시프시면 여끼 가시묜 되무니다.

originalText.text: Susana who processes applications, is not helpful. She takes her time to reply to emails and is very evasive/“busy” when you call. I finally received an email reply saying I was put on a ‘waitlist’ although she previously told me to submit my application because rooms were available and therefore I had agreed to pay the $200 application fee. I would not suggest staying here. The way I was treated during the application process and the lack in communication was extremely unprofessional. Unfortunately, Columbia University admins had recommended The Markle to me as an out-of-state student so I believed it would be a respectable place but was very disappointed. I reported the incident to Columbia University admins as well so that hopefully no other student experiences the same mistreatment.

originalText.text: We chose Markle as a residence for our 18 year old daughter who was attending ABT in New York.  It provided a safe and welcoming place for her.  Her lodging included 2 freshly cooked meals a day in their dining hall.  We were able to rent an air conditioner for her for the month. I also was allowed to stay on a cot in her room for a decent rate as needed on both her check in and check out.  I highly reccomend Markle to any woman, young or older needing a place to stay in New York.  We will definitely use it in the future should the need arise!
